attributes.action: Merge the newly proposed General Pharmaceutical Council with the already established General Medical Council to form a General Medical and Pharmaceutical Council.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Dear Prime Minister,
We would like to suggest that establishing a completely new body of a General Pharmaceutical Council (GPC) analogous to the medical profession's independent regulatory General Medical Council (GMC) will be costly 
to new pharmacist like myself and newly qualified pharmacists who will 
have marked rise in annual retention fees to fund an additional body. 
May I suggest that it would be a far better idea for both individual 
pharmacist and the government if both GMC and the newly proposed GPC were 
to merge to become a General Medical and Pharmaceutical Council (GMPC) 
so that costs could be distributed fairly and  the wider scope of 
regulating both health professions (Doctors and Pharmacist) are served to 
protect the public in mind. The existing GMC roles should include the 
regulation of pharmacist and become the base of regulation for both health 
professions as  it has many  years of experience of strict and 
stringent independent regulation.
